author: Our Editors
title: 10 Sustainable Sandals To Slide Into Summer 2024
text:
10 Sustainable Sandals To Slide Into Summer 2024
The Good Trade editors endorse products we‚Äôve personally researched, tested, and genuinely love. Learn more about our methodology and business model
here.
We‚Äôve worn and researched sustainable shoes for a decade ‚Äî these are 10 eco-friendly, ethical brands for comfortable and affordable sandals and slides that you‚Äôll reach for all summer long.
Summer‚Äôs here and we are ready. From sipping Aperol spritzes at outdoor happy hours, to hanging out at the beach, to visiting our local farmer‚Äôs market for the most delicious strawberries, we are embracing all of the warmer weather activities and the fashion that comes along with it. We‚Äôve rounded up a few of our favorite brands that are bringing ethical and fair trade sandals to the masses. We love all the new recyclable styles and are partial to easy slides ourselves. Happy summer (and shopping)!
Why consider sustainable sandals?
Sustainable sandals are better for not only the environment, but also your personal health. Some sandals, like the popular
jelly sandals, are made from PVC (polyvinyl chloride) and present significant environmental and health concerns. PVC is non-biodegradable and can release harmful chemicals like phthalates, which pose health risks and contribute to pollution throughout their lifecycle. (Don‚Äôt fret, as we‚Äôve listed some safer alternatives to the jelly sandal in our roundup below!) Opting to go for sustainable sandals made from eco-friendly materials like recycled plastics, organic cotton, and responsibly sourced leather, help reduce environmental impact, are often biodegradable, and are safer for our bodies.
Eco-friendly sandals are also produced using ethical labor practices, ensuring fair wages and safe working conditions for workers. Sustainable sandals are also designed for durability, reducing the need for frequent replacements and minimizing waste. By opting for sustainable sandals, you support practices that protect the planet, reduce pollution, and promote social responsibility, making a positive impact with every step!
Our criteria:
We‚Äôve worn, researched, and even corresponded with sustainable shoe brands over the years. Below, we‚Äôve compiled our 10 favorite sustainable sandals that are eco-friendly, ethically made, and are comfortable enough that you‚Äôll want to slip them on all summer. We‚Äôve included a variety of price points, too. We return to this list with regular updates as we find new options that meet the following criteria.
- ETHICAL PRACTICES | These sustainable shoe brands adhere to ethical commitments in all they do, including labor practices like fair wages and safe working environments. We‚Äôve prioritized brands that give back to their communities.
- ECO-FRIENDLY/SUSTAINABLE | All of the brands below sustainably source materials and produce their footwear thoughtfully, with most using all natural materials and recycled/upcycled materials when possible.
- COMFORTABLE | Our editors have tried all of the brands on this list, and confirmed that they‚Äôre comfortable and supportive so you can avoid the dreaded summer blisters.
- AFFORDABLE | Sandals, and especially sustainable sandals, can be an investment. We‚Äôve chosen brands at a variety of price points so there‚Äôs something for every budget.
Be sure to check out our guides on
ethical handbags, eco friendly sunglasses, and sustainable swimwear for all your summer essentials! Best Overall | Most Affordable | Best For Comfort
1. Birkenstock
Best For | Classic footbed
Sustainable Materials | Natural cotton canvas, EVA, cork-latex, leather
Size Range | 4 ‚Äì 12.5
Price Range | $110 ‚Äì $145
And now for the brand that won‚Äôt need an introduction: German-based
Birkenstock has been making shoes since 1774, though it wasn‚Äôt until 1902 when they developed the first ever footbed with contoured arch support. While you are probably most familiar with their suede and leather models, the brand also touts a vegan line with sustainable cork and latex for their same iconic look. The sandals are made from Birko-Flor¬Æ synthetic leather, which is comfortable, easy to clean, and made to last for decades.
2. Native Shoes
Best For | Water-friendly sandals
Sustainable Materials | Sugarcane-based EVA
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 12
Price Range | $30 ‚Äì $32
Change happens one (literal) step at a time.
Native Shoes wants us to feel better and lighter with their animal-free and eco-friendly sandals. These beach-ready sandals are hand-washable, water-resistant, and super affordable. Wear to the shore, a waterfall, or anywhere in between.
Customer Review | ‚ÄúStylish enough to wear out, not feeling sloppy, at the same time comfortable and practical to run errands and chase after my baby. Highly recommend.‚Äù ‚Äì Adrienne A. (
Read all reviews.)
3. Alohas
Best For | Sandals for work
Sustainable Materials | Responsibly sourced leather, vegan leather
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 14.5
Price Range | ‚Ç¨84 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨362
Alohas makes eco-friendly, sustainable sandals handcrafted in Spain using an on-demand model that reduces carbon emissions, fights overproduction, and creates no waste. They handpick providers by working with the Leather Working Group to find ethically sourced leather from environmentally certified suppliers. Alohas also makes vegan options with plant-based material that is sleek and sophisticated enough to shake up your workwear on those sweltering summer days.
4. Reformation
Best For | Strappy sandals
Sustainable Materials | Chrome-free cow leather
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 11
Price Range | $128 ‚Äì $298
A leader in both trends and sustainability,
Reformation has been climate neutral since 2015, with the goal of becoming climate positive by 2025. They also track all their products‚Äô environmental impact with RefScale, publishing everything on their site for full transparency. We love their strappy sandals to instantly transform a casual summer ‚Äòfit into a sexy date night look, or to refresh our favorite wedding guest dress.
5. Everlane
Best For | Flat sandals
Sustainable Materials | Recycled poly, leather, recycled rubber
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 11
Price Range | $98 ‚Äì $158
Everlane‚Äôs sandals are the perfect edition to your capsule wardrobe for this and many summers to come! Choose from their ReKnit line of sandals made from recycled materials, or try their Leather Working Group certified leather styles for a classic pair that you can wear with shorts, dresses, or your favorite summer linens. We love that the brand is transparent about their pricing and factories, so you can choose something you love that also supports the things that matter to you.
Customer Review | ‚ÄúLove these! Super comfy and they look great. Looking to get in another color.‚Äù ‚Äì Debste (
https://www.pntrs.com/t/8-9711-147620-104709?sid=sa-web--&website=248024&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.everlane.com%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-reknit-block-heel-sandal-blush-tan%3Fcollection%3Dwomens-shoes.)
6. beek
Best For | Leather sandals
Sustainable Materials | LWG-certified leather
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 12
Price Range | $139 ‚Äì $340
beek‚Äôs commitment to sustainable feminine footwear that‚Äôs comfortable and chic makes it easy to strut in style at all hours of the day. You‚Äôll find quality leather sandals made with soft vegetable-tanned leather and toxin free metallics‚Äîin addition to each sandal having molded arch support so your feet don‚Äôt get exhausted. They also age well the more you wear them! With every purchase, five meals are provided to a child in need through partnered food banks. Consider us hooked‚Äîwe‚Äôll take every pair possible.
Customer Review | ‚ÄúI have never bought a pair of shoes that were so comfortable to wear, provide great arch support, are chic and tremendously easy to walk in for hours. Love them! Buying a second pair.‚Äù ‚Äì Cheryl M. (
https://www.pntra.com/t/8-12059-147620-176515?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.beekshop.com%2Fproducts%2Ffinch-platinum-honey&sid=cl-web-pg-&website=248024.)
7. Nisolo
Best For | Huaraches
Sustainable Materials | LWG-certified leather, EVA
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 11
Price Range | $138
When we think of sustainable and ethical footwear, we immediately think of
Nisolo. Their line of boots, oxfords, mules, and sandals are all made ethically working with partners in Peru, Kenya, and Mexico. This offers jobs to more than 500 workers across their supply chain. Nisolo is best known for their huaraches, inspired by pre-Columbian Mexico and perfect for airy summer days.
Customer Review | ‚ÄúLove these opened toed sandals! They have already been great as transitional shoes in spring. Great for a weekend morning at the farmer‚Äôs market, but also professional enough for the office!‚Äù ‚Äì Rachel H. (
https://nisolo.uvwgb9.net/c/274622/698455/10656?subId1=sa-web--&u=https%3A%2F%2Fnisolo.com%2Fcollections%2Fwomens-sandals%2Fproducts%2Fwomens-all-day-cross-strap-sandal-almond.)
8. Quince
Best For | Nude tones
Sustainable Materials | Recycled poly, LWG-certified leather
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 10
Price Range | $60 ‚Äì $70
Made with high quality materials at affordable prices,
Quince‚Äôs collection of comfy sandals will elevate your wardrobe this summer without breaking the bank. Produced in a BSCI certified factory, these sandals are either crafted from leather tanned in an LWG certified tannery or from recycled materials, promoting sustainable business practices. With no sandals exceeding $70 pre-tax, you‚Äôll be saving significantly compared to similar products from Birkenstock, Alohas, and M.Gemi. Enjoy free shipping and 365-day free returns!
Customer Review | ‚ÄúThese sandals feel way more comfortable than I expected. The insole is padded and the adjustable straps allow plenty of room for my wide feet, even when they swell in the summer heat. Love them!‚Äù ‚Äì Carlyn T. (
https://quince.sjv.io/c/274622/1835359/21926?subId1=sa-web--&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.quince.com%2Fwomen%2Funisex-double-buckle-suede-slides%3Fcolor%3Dbone%26gender%3Dwomen%26tracker%3Dcollection_page__women%252Fshoes%252Fsandals__Sandals__6.)
9. VIVAIA
Best For | Block heels
Sustainable Materials | Recycled PET, sugarcane EVA, rice husks, herbal insoles, natural rubber
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 13
Price Range | $97 ‚Äì $125
VIVAIA was founded in 2020 with the goal to create timeless, comfortable, and environmentally conscious women‚Äôs footwear. The brand uses recylced materials in their stylish but wearable shoes, marrying function with design in a sustainable way. Their moisture-wicking insoles are antimicrobial and breathable, so you can confidently wear these cute heels to work without worrying about stinky feet at the end of the day. Check out our editor review for all the deats on how VIVAIA fares during long walks and airport trips!
Editor Review | ‚ÄúAs a travel shoe, VIVAIA fared like a dream: They easily slip off for security, are comfy enough in-flight, and allow you to step off the plane in a presentable look!‚Äù ‚Äì Ashley D‚ÄôArcy (
Read the full review.)
10. Melissa
Best For | Jelly shoes
Sustainable Materials | Recycled plastic, USDA-certified biobased materials
Size Range | 5 ‚Äì 13
Price Range | $49 ‚Äì $129
Melissa was founded in 1979 with a vision to transform plastic into extraordinary footwear. Committed to sustainability, Melissa focuses on designing, creating, and caring for shoes in eco-friendly ways. All Melissa shoes are made in Brazil by Grendene, one of the world‚Äôs largest footwear manufacturers, which owns its factories and ensures good working conditions, fair wages, and career development for over 16,000 employees. Melissa shoes are also vegan and cruelty-free, made from MelFlex, a durable PVC that can be recycled after years of use. The company also incorporates biobased materials from plants into their sandals, with each item designed for circularity.
Customer Review | ‚ÄúI love these. They go with everything. It‚Äôs like a shoe a Practical Barbie would wear to look everyday cute! Compliments galore.‚Äù ‚Äì Jenna T. (
https://www.shopmelissa.com/products/mar-platform-31686-ai860.)
Featured image is from
Alohas

author: Jayonna Scurry
title: Kingsport ministry transforms into cooling shelter and provides transportation during hot temperatures | WJHL | Tri-Cities News & Weather
text:
by: Jayonna Scurry
Posted: Jun 21, 2024 / 11:01 PM EDT
Updated: Jun 21, 2024 / 11:06 PM EDT
by: Jayonna Scurry
Posted: Jun 21, 2024 / 11:01 PM EDT
Updated: Jun 21, 2024 / 11:06 PM EDT
SHARE
KINGSPORT, Tenn. (WJHL)‚ÄîSince last November, Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries has provided a warming shelter and bus for those in need. Now that the temperatures have heated up, they have become cooling shelters.
The same bus that picked people up during the winter in cold, frigid temperatures is now being used to keep people out of the dangerously hot heat.
PREVIOUS: Kingsport ministry provides warming shelter and bus for those in need
‚ÄúThese folks are typically in the heat from 8 a.m. in the mornings to 8 p.m. when the Salvation Army and other places are closed during the daytime,‚Äù Jeff Kiser, Founder of Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministry Service, said. ‚ÄúWe try to provide drinks and food so that they don‚Äôt have to be out here dehydrated. These temperatures are horrible right now. So, severe heat is just as bad as severe cold.‚Äù
Kiser said the bus runs at least thrice daily, picking up un-housed people in various parks and places around the city. He then takes them to the Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries shelter located at 1136 S. Wilcox Drive.
Phillip Pinell met Kiser last year and stayed at the shelter for seven months.
‚ÄúHe told me that I could stay and that the food was not what I was expecting at all. It was amazing, actually. It was absolutely immaculate,‚Äù Pinell said. ‚ÄúHis donors and his attitude, the prospect of it all was extremely positive.‚Äù
Phillip Pinell in front of the Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries bus (Photo: WJHL) Pinell is a single father of two. After his parents moved away, he fell on hard times. Kiser is also a bail bondsman, so Pinell called him for help.
‚ÄúHe came to my rescue, he really did,‚Äù Pinell said.
‚ÄúA lot of us get lost. A lot of us lose our places. And we get to that point where this is what we have and they settle for it. But he shows us a way that is not only with God, but at the same time he offers positions and places where you can get jobs, a way to better yourself and a place that you‚Äôre not alone.‚Äù
Kiser said Pinell is truly a blessing.
‚ÄúHe has really thrived since he left here,‚Äù Kiser said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got a job. He‚Äôs got himself a new vehicle. God‚Äôs been good to him. And we like to think that something we may have said here made it happen by the grace of God.‚Äù
Pinell said Shepherd‚Äôs Watch is a great place to go if you need help.
‚ÄúNumber one, it‚Äôs alcohol, drug-free and it‚Äôs extremely positive if you‚Äôre having trouble, if you need to talk to somebody, this guy [Kiser] has people that are all around,‚Äù Pinell said. ‚ÄúI know a lot of these people here. They are wonderful people. And they have had similar stories. They feel like they have gotten lost. You can be found.‚Äù
Like Pinell, many others have sought refuge at Shepherd‚Äôs Watch. The shelter‚Äôs coordinator, Ryan Jones, used to be homeless. Now, he works for Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries, helping others.
‚ÄúHe is a fine young man,‚Äù Kiser said. ‚ÄúWhen I met him, his mother just passed away. He had lost his father a couple of years prior. This boy has turned his life around tremendously. He goes to church with me every Sunday morning. He is like my own child. He‚Äôs truly a blessing.‚Äù
Kiser said 20 to 40 people are currently being picked up out of the heat daily.
Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries also has church services at the shelter on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen souls saved,‚Äù Kiser said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what it‚Äôs all about. Getting these people rehabilitated back into society, get them off the drugs. That‚Äôs the main thing.‚Äù
Kiser encourages others to reach out to people who are homeless.
‚ÄúGo to the parks, take them cold water, take them Gatorades and get in the community and fill the needs,‚Äù Kiser said. ‚ÄúYou can see the needs when you step out into the community. You can see these folks are good folks. They just need a lift up and all of us working together by the grace of God, we can make it happen.‚Äù
Kiser said the community has shown up for the shelter since opening.
Pinell said the shelter is a wonderful place for support.
‚ÄúI made it home,‚Äù Pinell said. ‚ÄúAnd right now, I‚Äôm currently staying at a beautiful place, a beautiful house. I got back on my feet, and this is what this place can do for them.‚Äù
The Shepherd‚Äôs Watch Ministries shelter is open 24 hours a day. Kiser and Pinell both said volunteers and donations are always welcome.

author: Zak Failla
title: Final Dog Rescued From Devastating Christmas Day Fire Reunited With Family In Maryland
text:
On Monday afternoon, the
Wentz family in Salisbury lost it all when a fire broke out in their Coulbourn Mill Road residence.
The
two-alarm fire was tough for crews to get under control, and it took a crew of around 60 firefighters approximately an hour to get the flames under control.
Four dogs and a pet rabbit were rescued from the burning home, though an "Umbrella" Cockatoo and several fish also perished in the blaze.
Now, friends and neighbors are
rallying support for the family, raising thousands of dollars just days after the devastating blaze.
"James and Sarah would give you the shirt off their back with out hesitation," one of the couple's
best friends wrote. "Jaxsun is a smart and respectful young man, and Harper is the sweetest.
"With a little one on the way, Sarah and the family could use all the
support of friends family and community possible."
The patriarch of the family said they've lost almost everything, and opportunistic thieves broke in and stole what few items they salvaged from the master bedroom of the home.
It's not all bad news.
On Wednesday, James Wentz said that they've been reunited, adding that "(we) were made whole again."
The pup is breathing well without oxygen, though she's having some trouble getting around due to the lack of oxygen from the fire.
"We're so happy to have her here and I don't know what we would do without her," Wentz added.
In the three days since the fire tore through the Wentz home, more than 80 donors have raised nearly
$6,000, with more on the way.
Anyone looking to
assist the Wentz family can do so here.
Want breaking news in the DMV as it happens, or want to contribute?
Join the DMV All Incidents Facebook group.
St. Mary's
